title: Task Board
description: Visual kanban-style board for managing GST litigation tasks across different stages with drag-and-drop workflow management.

buttons.name: Create Task
buttons.purpose: Add new tasks directly to the board with appropriate stage assignment and priority levels
buttons.gstExample: Create 'Review GST assessment order' task in 'In Progress' column with high priority for urgent appeal deadline

buttons.name: Filter Tasks
buttons.purpose: Filter board view by case, priority, assignee, or deadline to focus on specific work streams
buttons.gstExample: Filter to show only 'High Priority' GST tasks due within next 7 days for deadline management

buttons.name: Drag to Move
buttons.purpose: Move tasks between board columns to update status and trigger workflow automations
buttons.gstExample: Drag 'GST appeal filing' from 'In Progress' to 'Completed' to automatically update case timeline

buttons.name: Quick Edit
buttons.purpose: Modify task details directly from board view without opening full task modal
buttons.gstExample: Update GST hearing preparation task deadline when court reschedules hearing date

buttons.name: Bulk Actions
buttons.purpose: Select multiple tasks for batch operations like reassignment or status updates
buttons.gstExample: Bulk assign all GST document review tasks to junior advocate when senior advocate is in court

philosophy: The GST litigation task board transforms complex legal workflows into visual, manageable processes. In tax law where cases involve multiple parallel tracks (appeals, refunds, audits, compliance), visual organization prevents important tasks from being overlooked and ensures systematic progress toward successful case resolution.

examples.solution: Board columns: 'Backlog' (new tasks), 'In Progress' (active work), 'Review' (completed work awaiting approval), 'Completed' (finalized tasks). Tasks flow systematically through stages with clear ownership and deadlines.
examples.benefit: Visual case progress tracking, clear workflow stages, systematic quality control, improved team coordination

examples.solution: Board shows all GST cases with color-coded priority levels: Red (urgent deadlines within 7 days), Orange (upcoming deadlines within 30 days), Green (routine tasks). Team can quickly identify priority work.
examples.benefit: Immediate priority visibility, reduced deadline stress, efficient resource allocation, improved case outcomes

examples.solution: Board view filtered by assignee shows individual workloads. Supervisors can quickly identify overloaded team members and redistribute GST tasks for optimal efficiency.
examples.benefit: Balanced team workloads, prevented burnout, consistent work quality, improved team satisfaction

examples.solution: Board provides real-time view of client case progress. During client meetings, advocates can show exactly where each GST matter stands and next steps in the workflow.
examples.benefit: Transparent client communication, professional service delivery, improved client confidence, competitive advantage

examples.solution: Board analytics show which stages accumulate tasks (e.g., 'Review' column consistently full). This identifies process bottlenecks for workflow optimization.
examples.benefit: Process improvement insights, reduced workflow delays, increased team efficiency, better case throughput

boardColumns.purpose: New tasks awaiting assignment or scheduling
boardColumns.gstExample: GST notice response tasks created by automation rules awaiting advocate review and priority assignment

boardColumns.purpose: Tasks currently being worked on by team members
boardColumns.gstExample: GST appeal drafting, document collection, client meetings - all active work streams

boardColumns.purpose: Completed work awaiting quality review or approval
boardColumns.gstExample: Draft GST appeal ready for senior advocate review before filing with appellate authority

boardColumns.purpose: Finalized tasks with all requirements met
boardColumns.gstExample: GST appeal successfully filed, acknowledgment received, next hearing date scheduled

boardColumns.purpose: Tasks waiting for external dependencies or client input
boardColumns.gstExample: GST refund claim preparation waiting for client to provide missing purchase invoices

visualIndicators.gstApplication: Red for urgent GST deadlines, blue for routine compliance, green for completed items

visualIndicators.meaning: Task completion percentage for complex workflows
visualIndicators.gstApplication: GST hearing preparation showing 75% complete with document collection and research finished
Quickly see which advocate is handling each GST matter without opening task details
'3 days' badge on GST appeal task showing urgent deadline approaching

bestPractices.title: Consistent Column Usage
bestPractices.description: Train team to use board columns consistently for accurate workflow tracking
bestPractices.gstApplication: Ensure all team members move GST tasks through same column progression for consistency

bestPractices.title: Regular Board Cleanup
bestPractices.description: Archive completed tasks periodically to maintain board clarity
bestPractices.gstApplication: Weekly archive of completed GST tasks to keep board focused on active work

bestPractices.title: Priority Visualization
bestPractices.description: Use color coding and labels consistently to communicate priority levels
bestPractices.gstApplication: Standardize GST task priority colors across all team members for clear communication

bestPractices.title: WIP Limits
bestPractices.description: Limit work-in-progress to prevent team overload and ensure quality
bestPractices.gstApplication: Limit each advocate to maximum 5 active GST tasks to maintain quality and prevent burnout
